Body:
Description: We are an international Group and have companies using a German or other local language Active Directory.

When there are users or domains, non "default ASCII"  characters like öäüß are replaced with an "?".

This happens also with Turkish, Czeck or Polish characters.

- How can we solve this issue?
- Is this an issue already with the raw data or only in the Enterprise Web view?

Steps to Reproduce Updated: Create account with samaccountname containing the values (Just copy from ticket)

Make sure the account appear in a check
- In the account tab select the option for "this account supports DES encryption"
- In group policy add the account directly to User Rights Assignment policy like "Logon as batch" or "Act as part of the operating system"

Run scan:
- In the generated html note that it works
- Import to WebUI and show that they are all ????

What We've Learned Updated: Customer is having issues when there are users or domains, non "default ASCII"  characters like öäüß are replaced with an "?". This happens also with Turkish, Czeck or Polish characters.
Next Steps Updated: Escalating this as per Joe's recommendation.
